content:
Sure, here is the Writing Quality criterion broken down into categories:

| Writing Quality | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Excellent | The critique is well-organized, clear, concise, and demonstrates exceptional writing skills with no grammar, spelling, or APA style errors. |
| Very Good | The critique is generally well-organized, clear, concise, and demonstrates good writing skills with only minor grammar, spelling, or APA style errors. |
| Good | The critique is adequately organized, clear, concise, and demonstrates satisfactory writing skills with a few grammar, spelling, or APA style errors. |
| Fair | The critique is somewhat disorganized, unclear, verbose, and demonstrates basic writing skills with several grammar, spelling, or APA style errors. |
| Poor | The critique is disorganized, unclear, verbose, and demonstrates poor writing skills with numerous grammar, spelling, or APA style errors. |

In addition to the above, this criterion also considers how well the student has followed accepted academic conventions in writing the Individual Test Critique. The critique should adhere to the rules of good academic writing, including accurate citations and references, proper formatting, and use of appropriate language and tone.
